question_sentence: President Joe Biden announced his bid for a second term this week, though polls consistently reflect concern about his age. How old is Biden?
evidence: At 80 years old, Biden is the oldest president in American history, and if reelected, he would be 86 when ending his second term. When pressed on his age during a news conference this week, Biden said he “took a hard look at it” before deciding to run and “feels good.”

question_sentence: Fox News rocked the media world this week when it announced it would part ways with which top-rated host?
evidence: Fox News and Tucker Carlson, the right-wing extremist who hosted the network’s prime time 8 p.m. hour, have severed ties, the network said in a stunning announcement on Monday.

question_sentence: British pop star Ed Sheeran was in court this week after being accused of copying which hit song from 1973?
evidence: Ed Sheeran took the stand this week in a high-profile copyright trial about whether his smash single “Thinking Out Loud” copied Marvin Gaye’s hit “Let’s Get It On.”

question_sentence: Which state passed a bill this week banning most sales of assault-style weapons?
evidence: In the wake of several recent mass shootings, Washington’s Democratic Gov. Jay Inslee this week signed a statewide ban on most sales of assault-style weapons, including the popular AR-15 rifle.

question_sentence: The World Health Organization recently warned of a “huge biological risk” after a laboratory was seized by fighters in which country?
evidence: The National Public Health Laboratory was seized this week by fighters in Sudan’s capital of Khartoum. A high-ranking medical source told CNN that the lab, which contains samples of diseases and other biological material, had been taken over by the Rapid Support Forces, the paramilitary group battling the Sudanese Armed Forces for control of the country.

question_sentence: Authorities are searching for several men after they recently escaped from jail in which state?
evidence: Four men escaped from a Mississippi jail over the weekend, officials said. One of them was found dead in a burned building after a standoff with authorities, and a second was apprehended in Texas. As of Friday, authorities were continuing their search for the two surviving escaped inmates.

question_sentence: Which airline recently posted record revenue despite its winter holiday meltdown?
evidence: Months after a holiday service meltdown, Southwest Airlines said its bookings in March were finally back on track. Revenue soared 22% to $5.7 billion in the quarter, according to the company.

question_sentence: Which world leader did the Bidens host at a glamorous White House state dinner this week?
choices: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol
evidence: President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden capped South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s official state visit with a lavish state dinner at the White House Wednesday night to celebrate the two nations’ 70-year alliance.

question_sentence: Which retailer, known for its iconic blue-and-white 20% off coupons, will soon get rid of all its inventory in a liquidation sale?
evidence: Deal hunters are preparing themselves for Bed, Bath & Beyond’s mammoth going-out-of-business sale.

question_sentence: A life-sized chocolate sculpture of King Charles III was unveiled this week to celebrate which upcoming occasion?
evidence: A chocolate sculpture weighing more than 50 pounds was unveiled by a confectionery brand to mark King Charles III’s coronation on May 6 in London’s Westminster Abbey.

question_sentence: Aaron Rodgers was traded from the Green Bay Packers to the New York Jets this week. How many Super Bowls did Rodgers win in Green Bay?
The photo above is an image of which natural occurrence?
Harry Belafonte, a trailblazing activist, actor and singer, died this week at age 96. He was the first Black man to receive which award?
True or false: President Joe Biden would become the oldest elected president in U.S. history if he is re-elected in 2024.
Which prominent Fox News host parted ways with the company this week?
The Miami Heat eliminated the Milwaukee Bucks from the playoffs. Miami is the first No. 8 seed to win an NBA playoff series since:
The U.S. embassy in which country was evacuated after intense fighting and military clashes this week?
Iconic talk show host Jerry Springer died this week at 79. Before TV fame, he served a term as mayor of what city?
An emerging COVID-19 variant known as Arcturus has been known to cause what symptom?
What song did South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol sing during a state dinner at the White House this week?
Wembley Stadium celebrated what landmark event this week?
evidence: The first football match at what was then called the Empire Stadium took place on 28 April 1923. During its century-long history, Wembley has been the site of England’s 1966 World Cup victory, the 1985 Live Aid concert and the Lionesses’ victory in the Women’s Euros last year.

question_sentence: Diane Abbott suggested in a letter to which newspaper that Jewish, Irish and Traveller people are not “all their lives subject to racism”?
evidence: Abbott subsequently issued an apology, claiming that an early draft of her letter had been mistakenly published. She has been suspended from the Labour Party pending an investigation.

question_sentence: According to new research, which biscuit is the most dunkable?
evidence: Researchers dunked 17 popular biscuits in cups of tea and recorded how many dunks each type survived before breaking apart. The Jaffa Cake was declared the winner – despite critics questioning whether it really is a biscuit – with 116 dunks, compared with the Digestive’s six.

question_sentence: Who told a New York court that Donald Trump “shattered my reputation”?
evidence: The journalist and author is suing the former president for battery and defamation, claiming he raped her in a department store changing room in 1996 and then denied it years later. Trump denies the charges and is not expected to appear in court.

question_sentence: The contents of which late music star’s former home are being put up for sale?
evidence: Around 1,500 items belonging to the former Queen frontman – including his Tiffany & Co moustache comb and a silk waistcoat decorated with cats – will be displayed at Sotheby’s London from 4 August until 5 September, and will then go under the hammer.

question_sentence: Who was criticised for saying Brits need to accept being “worse off” financially?
evidence: The Bank of England’s chief economist faced a fierce backlash after telling a podcast that UK households and companies need to “stop trying to maintain their real spending power by bidding up prices whether through higher wages or passing energy costs on to customers”.

question_sentence: Which Fox News host parted ways with the network this week?
evidence: Fox News announced the prime-time host’s abrupt departure on Monday, less than a week after agreeing to pay $787.5m to settle a defamation case in which Carlson played a starring role.

question_sentence: New polling data suggests that what percentage of 18- to 24-year-olds in the UK want to replace the monarchy with an elected head of state?
evidence: In a YouGov survey of 4,592 British voters, almost one in four Gen Z respondents said the British monarchy should be replaced with an elected head of state. Almost 60% said they believed King Charles was out of touch with the public.

question_sentence: The Republican National Committee (RNC) responded to Joe Biden’s re-election bid announcement by posting a video showing what?
choices: A simulation of Biden’s second term
Republican voters’ reactions to the announcement
A series of unflattering clips from Biden’s first term
evidence: The video attack ad was created using artificial intelligence and depicts “a second Biden term plagued by disasters”, said Quartz.

question_sentence: Temperatures hit record highs for April in which Spanish city this week?
evidence: A high of 38.8C was recorded in the Andalusian city on Thursday, as hot air sweeping into Spain from North Africa this week results in temperatures up to 15C warmer than expected for April.
